creator: jochen.wiedmann@softwareag.com
text:
Hi,

I have a document that's fed into Fop 0.20.3rc. Fop seems to
process fine, in particular it seems to create pages (see output
below). However, it never stops working. In the class path are
only files from the 0.20.3rc distribution.

Command line:

  java -classpath lib\xerces-1.2.3.jar;lib\xalan-
2.0.0.jar;build\fop.jar;lib\logkit-1.0b4.jar;lib\avalon-framework-
4.0.jar;lib\batik.jar org.apache.fop.apps.Fop -fo fop2.xml  -pdf master.pdf

Output:

[INFO]: FOP 0.20.3rc
[INFO]: building formatting object tree
[WARN]: property - "last-line-end-indent" is not implemented yet.
[WARN]: property - "last-line-end-indent" is not implemented yet.

creator: christian.geisert@isu-gmbh.de
text: Can you attach a (minimal) example fo which reproduces this bug ?

creator: jochen.wiedmann@softwareag.com
text:
Created attachment 1156
Sample file demonstrating the problem

creator: jochen.wiedmann@softwareag.com
text: Sorry, I though I had that. Now it is there.

creator: christian.geisert@isu-gmbh.de
text:
Fixed in maintenance branch.
label-end() function didn't get calculated

creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text:
No, label-end() *was* computed. The problem was that the guy set
provisional-distance-between-starts="1em" which is too small for anything
and causes an infinite loop in Block.layout(), happily adding empty lines.

creator: raultman@fcci-group.com
text:
Could someone confirm that the endless loop terminator in 0.20.5 does not catch 
this?

creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text: The loop terminator does not catch this because the loop is in FOText.

creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text: *** Bug 33593 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: adelmelle@apache.org
text:
While the output is still not entirely correct, the reported problem itself does no longer apply to FOP trunk, 
hence I'm closing this bug.

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
